The Barbican Art Museum in London has acquired a new work by the Italian avant-garde contemporary artist Eltorella Pindell, who died earlier this month at the age of eighty-two. The museum has also added two more works by Pindell to its collection.Born in Camasci, Italy, in 1928, Pindell studied at the Art School in London before eventually moving to the United States in the 1950s, where she attended Yale University in New Haven, Connecticut. She continued her art education at the Art Institute of Chicago, where she studied with Richard Diebenkorn, and eventually found her way to London, where she continued her art-making practice.
